description: Render & paint existing brickwork finish to house to match existing rendered sections to front elevation and retention of front dormer windows and roof light
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).

Notwithstanding the details shown on drawing PS-R-PA01 Rev. A accompanying the application, the face and cheeks of the front dormer windows shall be tile hung to match the appearance of the roof of the existing dwelling unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with Policy 26 of the Havering Local Plan.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with Mr Adams (Agent) by phone and e-mail. It was noticed during the planning process that the dormers were not in the correct position as approved as part of P0020.22. Also, an additional roof light had been added in between them. Neighbours were re-consulted for a further 21 days due to the revised description and plans. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 09-01-23.
